title: Student wears ‘Maddy is in my freezer’ on T-shirt at bar crawl
text:
The student’s t-shirt was covered in offensive messages (Picture: SWNS)

A Cambridge University student has been pictured with ‘Maddy is in my freezer’ written across his back during a night out.

The unidentified man was taking part in a ‘white t-shirt social’ organised by Queen’s College Boat Club, in which participants are encouraged to scrawl messages across each other’s clothes.

It is not known whether the student was aware of what had been written on his back.

As well as referencing missing Madeline McCann, the t-shirt also sported a string of controversial messages including ‘Tommy Robinson – what a babe’ and ‘f**k Greta #drownthepolarbears.’

It also contained the words ‘Yeah Maggie!!!!’, ‘I [love] Brexit’, ‘#LeaveEU’, ‘#Ukip’, ‘#F**ktheEU’ and ‘Cymru am byth!’, which means long live Wales.

He was taking part in the ‘Big Boatie Bar Crawl’ (Picture: The Tab /SWNS)

The student had been taking part in the ‘Big Boatie Bar Crawl’ and was photographed at The Regal, a Wetherspoons pub.

Queens’ Boat Club organised the event, but it was attended by 20 different college rowing societies, from the majority of Cambridge colleges.

Each of the boat clubs followed individual routes across Cambridge before all meeting in The Regal at 10pm.

The President of Queen’s College Boat Club has already distanced themselves from the incident, stating that messages written on the t-shirts are ‘the sole responsibility of individual attendees’.

Speaking to student newspaper The Tab, Charlotte Hallam continued: ‘[They] have no connection whatsoever with the views or values held by Queens’ College Boat Club or by Queens’ College.’

White t-shirt socials have been banned across the country (Picture: The Tab /SWNS)

Edward Parker Humphreys, President of Cambridge University Students’ Union, said the writing of offensive messages on t-shirts ‘should not be tolerated within Cambridge’.

He added: ‘Student clubs and societies should consider whether white t-shirt parties such as this are appropriate events to host, given their tendency to produce offensive and discriminatory material.’

White t-shirt socials were recently banned at Leicester University, after one student was spotted with ‘Hitler wanted my kind alive’ scrawled on his shirt.

Another student was pictured wearing a high-vis jacket with the message ‘I am a Nazi’ on the back.

description: A Cambridge University student had 'Maddy is in my freezer' written across his white t-shirt during a Queen's College Boat Club bar crawl.
